note.p: Death: York Place, Portman Square, London (25 March 1842)
Education: MD (1806, King's College, Aberdeen); MD (1817, St Andrew's University)

Career: Entered the Royal Navy; Surgeon on the "Victory" at Trafalgar, and with Nelson when he died (1805); published a narrative on the death of Nelson and possessed the bullet which killed Nelson; Physician, Greenwich Hospital (1806-1840)
References: G C Cook, 'Richard Dobson Kt MRCS FRS (1773-1847) and the inferior status of naval medicine in the early nineteeth century: End of the Fleet physicians' in NR 2005 pp 35-43
